pages.text: Some items are used to emit particles for various purposes such as a source of particles in an $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/linear_accelerator#ion_source)accelerator ion source$(/l) or a source of gamma rays in $(l:blocks_and_machines/irradiator)Irradiators$(/l). The amount of stored particle units (pu) can be seen on the tool tip of these items. The use of the item can be looked up in JEI.$(br2)The following pages list the different kinds of particle sources.

pages.title: Isotope Sources
pages.text: Isotope Sources emit particles from the isotope inside them. They have 2 different uses. The radioisotopes that emit strong gamma rays (e.g Co-60, Ir-192) are used in the $(l:blocks_and_machines/irradiator)Irradiator$(/l) to sterilize items. Other isotope sources are used in the $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/linear_accelerator#ion_source)accelerator ion source$(/l) to create particles.
Tungsten filaments are a simple source of electrons in $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/linear_accelerator#ion_source)accelerator ion sources$(/l). They wear out after a while and must be replaced.

pages.title: Antimatter Cells
pages.text: Antimatter cells can be used in $(l:multiblocks/accelerators/linear_accelerator#ion_source)accelerator ion sources$(/l) as a source of antimatter nuclei. More information on cells is found in the $(l:items_and_devices/cell)cells section$(/l)
